speaker: Episode 56 - The Suffering Game - Chapter Six
Griffin
lines: Previously, on the Adventure Zone…

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see in this sapphire mirror, another world. You see tens of thousands of these floating white lights sailing over a giant lake comprised of swirling rainbow-hued waters...

speaker: Griffin
lines: Another rift opens in space and out of that rift, that white fire comes out of it. The Red Robe leans down and you can like see the Red Robe doing this now, and it extends a skeletal finger, and it’s a symbol that thieves use to let others know that it’s gonna pop off soon.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s fun!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Three words appear on the ceiling Boss Rush. Begin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And all of a sudden Cam is now… levitating??

speaker: Justin
lines: Hell yeah!

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he holds the wand in his mouth--

speaker: Magnus
lines: [exasperated and amazed] You could’ve done that the whole time?! We’ve been carrying your head!!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He looks over at you, Magnus, and he says,

speaker: Cam
lines: [muffled, with the wand in his mouth] Spell slots!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then he points his wand at Jenkins and the two meat monsters and he says,

speaker: Cam
lines: Heads up!

speaker: Announcer
lines: What’s waiting for our heroes at the end of Wonderland? It’s not a cool-ass, weed-smoking caterpillar, I’ll tell you that much! It’s the Adventure Zone!

speaker: Clint
lines: May I ask a stupid question?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, please!

speaker: Clint
lines: Is there some significance to ‘boss rush room’?

speaker: Griffin
lines: A boss rush is just like a video game thing, like in Mega Man, before you face the final boss, you have to fight all the bosses that you fought so far.

speaker: Clint
lines: Right. Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s good content though, because that’s good for our elderly listeners as well.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s true!

speaker: Justin
lines: All the senior citizens that listen --

speaker: Griffin
lines: [‘elite gamer’ voice, sarcastically with irony] Who’ve never played a fuckin Mega Man game because they’re not ““true elite gamers””.

speaker: Travis
lines: [joining in sarcastically] Yeah, they’re newbs, they’re cas-ualls.

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh, thank you. Thank you for the compliment.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Dad, you’re such a caz-yullll.

speaker: Travis
lines: You’re a caz-u-all.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh so Cam, with his wand in mouth -- by the way, we need to ret-con Taako, did you get your wand repaired at some point? ‘Cause I got a lot of tweets from folks last episode saying you did break your wand in the ogre trial, and the reason we didn’t remember that is because it was a hundred and fifty THOUSAND years ago.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, that was, that was in the, uh, novella that was given out as a pre-order bonus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, there was a novella in which you duct-taped your shit back together.

speaker: Travis
lines: [pleased with himself for the joke/Harry Potter reference] With Spell-o-tape!

speaker: Justin
lines: I fixed my shit with magic. Like it’s ludicrous to me that I wouldn’t have fixed it by now.

speaker: Clint
lines: Sure.

speaker: Justin
lines: C’mon.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Cam casts Maximillian's Earthen Grasp. And because there’s not really any earth in here, a big ol’ hand, bigger than a mage hand, forms out of some of the bodies of the mannequins in the back of the room. And this hand reaches out and tries to grab---

speaker: [Sound of lots of dice clattering loudly on a table]
Griffin
lines: Whoa, what the fuck was that?!

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] That was just me dumpin’ a bunch of dice on the table.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, all right.

speaker: Justin
lines: Gettin’ ready to play Dungeons and Dragons! {320}

speaker: Griffin
lines: It grabs the meat monster on the right, [sound of dice rolling] and it does grab it for… 12 points of damage! Which is actually enough to kill it. So I think this fist just comes in and it squeezes this meat monster into hamburger goo.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ewwww. [makes a gross squishing noise]

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then... as a bonus action, Cam opens that hand up just flat-palm, and sends it flying across the room, smashing into the other meat monster, and just kind of swatting it up against the wall.

speaker: Justin
lines: I, I too am a Magic Boy and I’ve never had a bonus action in my fuckin’ life. Like, what’s the story with that?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, like he’s really coppin’ all of our swagger, huh?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Cam is-- Cam is uninhibited by a bunch of extra weight. He’s an efficient -- what do you cast spells with? Your brain? He is just a streamlined spell casting machine.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: I, I can live with that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, next up is… Mmm-- who was at the bottom of the action? Magnus!

lines: Me! Yeah, I’m gonna step up, and I’m gonna punch Jenkins with Phantom Fist.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Just for old time’s sake, or?

lines: Okay!

lines: Uh, attack.

lines: Okay, that is– that is more than sufficient.

lines: Okay, cool. D4 [rolls dice] 3. Plus 4, so that’s 7 damage! And then I’m gonna push him back into that sphere of tentacles and Della Reeses.

lines: Okay, uh, all right, you do so--

lines: Okay. That, uh, that hurt- that hurts him... a lot. Next up is Jerkins. Which is, what I- I guess it autocorrected? [Clint giggles] I have it saying, in my text document, “Jerkins goes after Magnus who is next” to try to remember the order. So even my text document is not a fan. Um, Taako, roll 2d6 cold damage, for Hunger of Hadar.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yuppp. [rolls his dice] That’s a 2. [rolls again] And a 3.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Kay. Jerkins is lookin’ pretty bad-off. [pauses dramatically] Merle! Somethin’ bad happens.

lines: [apprehensively] Yeah?

lines: Della Reese… rears back her angelic arm to stab her magic sword into Jenkins, but ju--

lines: [sarcastic] This is gonna be great!

lines: But riiiight before she makes contact--

lines: [quietly and nervously] Yeah?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then disappears. And, Merle, you’ve cast this spell like countless times--

speaker: Clint
lines: Countless.

speaker: Griffin
lines: But you’ve never seen anything like this. In fact, all these hiccups that your holy powers have been going through all day, you haven’t experienced anything quite like it in all your days of cleric-dom. {634}

speaker: Um, Jenkins is going to take a step backwards towards the mannequin pile, out of the sphere of Hadar’s whatever, and he casts [Travis starts laughing] outta Bill Hader’s evil sphere, and he casts Dispel Magic. And the field of inky black tentacles disappears.
Griffin
lines: All three of you notice, at the far edge of the room just behind the mannequin body pile, and sort of adjacent to the door - the exit door to this room - all three of you see - I won’t make you roll a perception check because it’s pretty clear as day - you see a dresser just appear out of nowhere. And then it quickly disappears, and it’s replaced by a bookshelf. And then that bookshelf disappears, and then it’s a fireplace, and then it’s a lamp, and then it’s nothing.

speaker: And Magnus with your True Sight, you see the Red Robe channelling the black smoke to create those objects over there on the far end of the room.
Justin
lines: Uhm- [Justin clears his throat]

speaker: Griffin
lines: You got a pretty bad-off Jerkins. All the area of effect spells have been spirited away at this point. And you got your, the -- well, you don’t know what’s happening but there’s magical objects appearing in the corner of the room.

lines: Uhhhhmmm, okayyy. Uh, can I do an arcana check as a free action to see if I have any insight into that? What’s happening over there..?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sure!

lines: [rolls] Uh, that’s a 2! Haaa!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s a cool - it’s a nice dresser, you notice that! Probably full of… wonderful clothes. But it’s weird that it turned into a bookshelf though. You’re like, “What?! That’s craaazyyy!”

speaker: Justin
lines: [in a monotone] That’s crazy… Uhmm [hums as he thinks] I’m going to um, hit, that fuckin--

lines: Oh, by the way, I forgot to mention this the room around you, it kinda… it appears like you’re on the Rockport Limited again. Like, the room around you looks like you’re in a train car battling, and there’s like virtual windows looking out to like the passing countryside, like you’re on a train. Like, the room is recreating the scenes of these classic battles.

lines: What a nice treat for the audience!

lines: Uhh let’s see, I’m going to…hurt Jenkins! [Griffin starts giggling as Justin struggles] Mhmm. With a magical spell! Of my own choosing! ...Of my own…

lines: Lemme just roll some damage real quick.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, for sure. Jenkins goes flying backwards as these rays hit him and he is vanquished. And as he goes down, something happens that hasn’t happened in a while! And that is--

speaker: Travis
lines: We feel something! [Justin holds back laughter]

speaker: Griffin
lines: He, he drops his wand, and Taako, your Umbra staff turns inside out, and sucks that wand in, and devours it. And it’s been awhile since you’ve taken down a magic-user like this but, [Justin Mhm] you remember the Umbra staff is capable of consuming the magic essence of your defeated foes. So it has a little wand snack [Justin makes Cookie Monster omnomnom noises] And it turns right-side out again. And you feel… you feel… energised!

speaker: Justin
lines: Oooh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You feel like you’ve recovered, which is weird, you haven’t felt that in Wonderland very much, and you have in fact recovered your spell slots. {1108}

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing with relief] Ohh hoho, delicious! Delicious!

speaker: Griffin
lines: With that, Jenkins goes flying back, his mannequin sorta falls out of his form and goes flying into the pile in the back of the room. And that pile transforms, with the help of some of that black smoke, into a massive shape, the biggest shape you’ve seen so far. It’s about 10 feet tall, and it has sorta a conical shape, and then as it starts to take form, you realise it is the shark tank from your race in the Goldcliff Desert. And in fact, the screen walls and ceiling around you transform as if to look like the badlands surrounding Goldcliff flying past you. And you are up against the shark tank. And, next in the order is Merle!

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay! I’m going to --I can’t heal--

lines: Nope!

lines: I suck at attacks--

lines: Okay!

lines: This puts me in touch with a god or god’s servant, so in this case Pan. I get to ask a single question--

lines: [gleefully] Oho this is perfect, thank you. This is a gift.

lines: Yeah.

lines: And everyone’s just like, okay.

lines: I’m of no use as long as my powers aren’t working!

lines: Yeeep.

lines: [holding back laughter] And so to combat that, you use one of your powers!

lines: You - you pray---

lines: Sometimes.

lines: -and in times of need, he turns to his god for guidance.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Hit him up.

lines: Like any good religious person, when he needs something.

lines: Okay, what’s your question.

lines: [singing] Hellooooo~ PAA-aaaannnn--

lines: You want more?

lines: [overlapping] Oh god, no!

lines: Well, I mean, just the question--

lines: And I have to get a truthful answer? Correct?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh. Yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Merle
lines: What is going on with my holy powers?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Here is the truthful response - this is Griffin, not Pan speaking. [“Pan” plays quietly] Here is the truthful response to your question, Merle Pan’s not answering. And it’s not… it’s, you know beyond a shadow of a doubt, he’s just not... He’s just not there! And he’s not, he’s… he’s not there supporting you with a holy power, he’s not... He’s just– he’s just gone! And this is fuckin’ terrifying. Like you, this spell that you’re casting is essentially like a telephone call of a prayer, and Pan has always answered… but not this time. He is not there.

speaker: Clint
lines: So--

speaker: Griffin
lines: And it’s not like, it’s not, you can tell, it’s not like you’re getting bad reception on your prayer. You feel it going through, he’s just not- he's just not pickin’ up.

speaker: Clint
lines: He’s not there, or he’s not answering?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You don’t, you don’t know the answer to that. But he’s not… he just. The reason that your spells aren’t working is because they are powered by Pan and right now, Pan is not there for you.

speaker: Clint
lines: So, so I, I get another turn then, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, yeah, if you wanna-- yeah, sure. I think that’s only fair!

speaker: Clint
lines: But now my spells are working, just not as well! Correct?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uhm, they are working less and less well, yes.

lines: Okay! What’s that do?

lines: It is a-- I’m still buffering -- [adopting a radio announcer voice for quickly reading the fine print] “Still Buffering” is a copyrighted feature --

lines: That’s fun.

lines: [reading from the D&D manual] Uh, “whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or the saving throw.”

lines: All right and they get to add d4 to add to their attack or saving throw.

lines: Okay, cool! Shark tank is up. Um, and the shark tank’s not like moving at tank speed, obviously, otherwise it’d like burst through the wall or something. Instead, it opens up its mouth, and you see that nasty barbed spear that it used during the race and it points it at… Magnus.

lines: Well, okay, well first, I’m going to tell my shield the bold story of the time I fought the shark before.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [‘Sauté!’ by Griffin McElroy begins to play - funky, electronic disco adventure music] You all clear the door and as you do the purple worm kinda rears its body up to come smashing down and you just barely clear the door as it comes down behind you. And then the door… disappears. And Magnus, you saw the Red Robe move through too, so everybody has moved out of the room!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can tell that this chamber that you’ve stepped out into is not like the other ones you’ve been in since you’ve been here in Wonderland. It’s pretty dark in here, but you can tell that this chamber is still circular, but it’s way way bigger than all the rooms you’ve been in so far. It’s cavernous. And behind you, you see this massive cylinder. And it’s what you just stepped out of, but it’s completely featureless, except for a small label on its exterior wall that has your guys’ names on it. And as you look around, you see there’s a bunch of these different cylinders - 38 of them to be exact - all wrapping around a huge central staircase. This big round central staircase which climbs 20 feet up to a circular platform at the centre of the chamber.

speaker: And as you start to approach that staircase, Cam kinda hangs back and he says,
Cam
lines: Hey, uh, listen, I’m pretty sure you guys are gonna get out of here, so I’m gonna part ways with you now.

lines: What?

lines: It’s like I said, Magnus, I’m a living disembodied head. I’m pretty sure the only reason I’m alive is because Wonderland is keeping me alive, eternally, just to pump more suffering out of me so if I leave this place with y’all, I’m toast.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Wait so, you’d rather - so lemme get this straight - you’d rather stay in here, as a head, forever in a place that feeds on suffering, rather than go with us and be free from this.

lines: Uh, he says,

lines: Yeah!

lines: And he was wearing uh-- he kind had it tucked up, tucked up behind his ear, and he just kinda does a little maneuver to put it in his mouth and he flings it at you.

lines: And it’s super cool!

lines: It’s uh, okay. He goes and sorta skulks around and behind the massive cylinder that you all came out of.

lines: Yeah.

lines: 15. Wow. That’s a good investigation check.

lines: Magnus, you-- yeah, I mean, with a nat 20 you recognise that every chamber has labels with names on it. You see one that has Lucretia, Sterling, and Rowan’s name on it.

lines: Wait, one chamber that has all three names?

lines: Uh huh! And there’s a bunch of chambers with a bunch of different names - you don’t recognise any of the other ones--

lines: You said Lucretia, did you mean Lucretia?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh sorry sorry sorry! No, no, no no, Antonia, not Lucretia. Um, yeah, it has their names on it, you don’t recognise any of the other names on the labels. With a 20, Magnus, you also realise, this cylinder that you stepped out of it is… you can kinda tell, especially if you walk up that staircase a little bit to get a better angle on it, it’s more or less the exact shape of all of the rooms that you have been in, in Wonderland.

speaker: Travis
lines: So it was just the same… cylinder over and over again made to look different through the magic smoke stuff, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yup.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um. A spotlight comes on from the ceiling shining down on top of the central circular platform, which you can get a better angle on if you go up that staircase.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah! I do that!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Atop that central platform that spans about 30 feet in diameter, you see a few dozen seated figures all positioned around a raised catwalk that vivisects the circle. But all these figures are stationary because they are all mannequins. And these mannequins, they are the same ones that you saw during Heart Attack. They are all dressed up in high fashions, kinda like the stuff you’ve seen Lydia and Edward in, and simultaneously they all point up to the catwalk where a spotlight is illuminating the catwalk.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is there anything on the catwalk?

lines: Nope.

lines: Is it time for us to do our sexy turn on the catwalk?

lines: Uh, I think this would be a pretty good time for that.

lines: I look at Taako.

speaker: Taako
lines: I don’t -- I don’t understand, no, I‘m kinda freaked out. What’s going on?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh, I think you need to get up there and strut.

lines: I think it’s a... fashion… show?

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m not a piece of meat!

speaker: Magnus
lines: This is what you were born to do, Taako!

speaker: Taako
lines: No! I mean I’m not a model, I’m a wizard and a chef! I don’t understand what I’m being asked to do here.

lines: I think you need to… booty tooch--

lines: Why?! The– the things you’re saying make no sense! I’m not just gonna strut across a catwalk for your delight!

lines: All of the mannequins simultaneously sorta pull their arms back and point, sorta more forcefully at the stage. All of them are looking at one of you. Their gaze is sorta split between all of you. And they are all pointing up to the catwalk.

speaker: Justin
lines: I cast Prestidigitation, shoot sparks out of my fingers, cast Minor Illusion and put myself in a dope outfit, and start walkin’ down the catwalk with all the style and panache I can muster, which is, I should note, a fuckin’ lot.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, roll a charisma roll. Roll a performance roll! We’ve never--

lines: Oh, that’s weird. I got 30. Cause it’s fuckin’ so fly. [Griffin laughs] That’s very strange and interesting.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll Performance. You’ve got advantage on this Performance roll.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, 16 or 4, so it’s definitely 16.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh yeah--

speaker: Justin
lines: I don’t know if there’s any modifiers--

speaker: Griffin
lines: The crowd is going wild. You stop in this, in the spotlight in this catwalk and the crowd is just fuckin’ losin’ their minds. And then all of a sudden all of them are looking at you, Magnus and Merle, and pointing up to the catwalk.

speaker: Magnus
lines: All right!

speaker: Merle
lines: I’ll go next!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Awww.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, I’m next.

lines: Okay!

speaker: Clint
lines: I saunter up and what I do is I cunningly take my hand and pull my shirt down off one shoulder [Griffin Oh fuck!] and I gyrate it [Justin Nice.] and I look seductive, and then waddle across the catwalk [Justin laughing mockingly] to stand next to my… stunning cosmetically enhanced friend.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll a Performance check.

speaker: [sound of dice rolling and then a hand smacking the table in frustration]
Clint
lines: Another freakin’ 5.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ummmm, there’s a few-- you hear like 3 of the mannequins be like [slow claps, Clint laughs]  You do not get as warm a reception. And now all of them are looking at you, Magnus, and pointing up to the catwalk.

speaker: Travis
lines: Awesome, I get up, and I, using like my Chance Lance do like a super sick kinda baton slash like y’know kinda like, gun twirling exercise like you might see in like a military show.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, roll performance.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s a 13?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, you get a pretty, you get an okay reception. You get a pretty good reception for that. All of you are up on the catwalk now, and, uh, you hear Edward say -- you don’t see either of the liches but you hear their voices, and you hear Edward say

speaker: Edward
lines: You did it! I don’t know how, but you did it!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Lydia says

speaker: Lydia
lines: Very few people have stood where you’re standing now, having conquered suffering itself to claim their prize. Give them a hand, folks!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And every mannequin just stands up and is, like, giving you a big standing ovation. And Edward says, uh

speaker: Edward
lines: This resolve, this desire to do whatever it takes no matter the cost to save yourselves -- Do you know who you three remind me of?

speaker: Magnus
lines: No?

speaker: Merle
lines: Who?

speaker: Edward
lines: Us!

speaker: Travis
lines: Eugh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hear Lydia say {4850}

speaker: Lydia
lines: There were three of us, once, lifetimes ago. We had another sibling, a younger brother, Keats. It was the three of us, surviving against all odds. The world against us. But Keats– Keats got sick. And he wouldn’t get better. So Edward and I joined a necromantic circle to try and save him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Edward says

speaker: Edward
lines: We were… unsuccessful, but we found joy in our newfound powers. That’s when we became liches and managed to sustain ourselves with our love for our dear Keats and each other. But when that became insufficient, we discovered ways of using other people's emotions to sustain ourselves. Emotion is… so powerful, and practical. That’s how we discovered that, well, suffering’s much more effective than love.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Lydia says

speaker: Lydia
lines: We’re the oldest living -- well, un-living things in this whole world, I’d reckon. Here’s a fun fact they don’t tell you about liches Your spectral form resembles what you looked like when you consigned your soul to lichdom. That means we have to spend an eternity in the drab, black robes of our circle.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, and Edward says

speaker: Edward
lines: Eventually, we discovered how to channel suffering to create new garments for ourselves -- fantastic garments! Then we learned how to channel it into other forms. We could summon small household objects, and then bigger objects, and then finally summoning entire rooms from the ether. That’s how we came up with Wonderland! It’s a perfect centrifuge for extracting suffering from those who, fueled by greed, came to visit us. Wonderland has taken many forms over the past few centuries, but these games are actually kind of a new touch that we’re pretty excited about.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And, uh, Lydia says

speaker: Lydia
lines: And thanks to your Animus Bell, business has been booming lately.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And, uh, every mannequin kinda walks up to the catwalk and they’re kind of, like, they’re kind of reaching for you? Like they’re desperate fans just trying to get ahold of your -- the hem of your garment. And Edward says

speaker: Edward
lines: This place has always thrived because of, well, what else? Advertising! We’ve got a few consistent channels. Surely you received a brochure in the mail, or saw our billboards or met someone drawn here by a beam of magical light? Those are just a few tools of the trade, and they served us well during our residency here. But do you all know the most successful type of advertising?

speaker: [All at once]
lines: Word of mouth?

speaker: Edward
lines: Magnus, you landed on skull in the last round, didn’t you?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yes.

speaker: Edward
lines: Bad luck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you hear the Animus Bell ring. And just like all the other grand relics you’ve seen used during your journey, the effects are immediate and horrible. Taako and Merle, make a perception check for me?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, I’ll roll another 5. [rolls] Oh, 19.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, 9 for me.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see Magnus reel backwards, threatening to just fall straight back, and, um, you both see a light cast out of the back of his body for just the briefest moment as he falls. And then you see him spasm, and come to, and he throws a leg back to catch himself before he fully loses his balance. And he steadies himself on Rail-Splitter. And he stands up to face you, and he says

speaker: Edward as Magnus
lines: You know, boys, I don’t think Wonderland’s that bad. You know, I feel like I’ve learned a lot about myself here, and I feel like our friendship has grown even more powerful, don’t you think?

speaker: Magnus
lines: [through Travis’s voice again] Ahem. I didn’t say that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Nobody hears you say that, Magnus, because you’ve just had the singular sensation of having your soul knocked out of your still-living body. It was as soon as you heard the Animus Bell ring, and it felt like getting kicked by a horse, followed by this absolute numbness that, if you had any breath, would take it away. And you see the back of yourself for a moment? Which is fucking weird. And then your vision goes gray and, in fact, the world goes gray. And you are floating backwards into the ethereal plane. And the scene around you is still there as it was moments ago.

speaker: You see yourself kind of catch yourself from falling. You see Taako and Merle sort of looking at you. Um, and you also see some other stuff too. You see other figures in the room. You see small, white, humanoid figures that are hiding behind the mannequins and clinging to the ceiling. And as you start to look around at them, they scurry away and out of sight. But you also see a tear in the fabric of space, and it looks familiar. Because you saw something similar to that during your time in Lucas’ lab. It is a rift open to the astral plane where the souls of the deceased go after their death in the material plane. And you are drifting into it, Magnus. Because you’re dying.
Travis
lines: [frantically] I’m -- I’m gonna push as hard as I can back towards my body!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uhh, we’ll get to that in just a second. I wanna get back to Merle and Taako.

speaker: Justin
lines: One thing you can say That is bad luck. [crosstalk in agreement] Truth in advertising.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Merle and Taako, you see Magnus catch himself, and you see Lydia now, step out from behind Magnus. And she has this -- she’s wearing this black-and-white elegant Victorian-era dress, and she smiles and you see the smile creep onto Magnus’ face. And for a second, you see the faint figure of Edward surrounding Magnus, um, and his image fades and you hear Magnus say

speaker: Edward as Magnus
lines: I think I’m gonna head to Neverwinter and tell everyone I meet to get down here to Wonderland ASAP! (Pronounced a-sap) Lots of riches! More than I could even carry out!

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh, so we know that this -- that Edward is possessing Magnus, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right. And ‘possessing’ is not the right word. ‘Cause Magnus isn’t in there anymore. Edward is– Edward is Magnus right now.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright. I’ll talk to him.

speaker: Merle
lines: So, uh, Magnus! Uhhh, you really think we had that--

speaker: Edward as Magnus
lines: That’s me! Big, tough man Magnus! That’s me all over. I’m gonna rush in! Let’s do it!

speaker: Merle
lines: You think we had a really good time in here, did ya?

speaker: Edward as Magnus
lines: I mean it was a little bit rough, I guess, but uh, think of all the riches we found? You know?

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, what did we find, exactly?

speaker: Edward as Magnus
lines: All the riches and gold and rubies?

speaker: Merle
lines: I don’t… I don’t remember that. You know what? We’re all -- we did a good job, we won the game, so I’m with you, Magnus! Let’s head out and go spread the good word. And oh, but first! But first, of course, we do need the bell, right? We earned the bell! ‘Cause we won the game, and it’s the ‘heart’s desire’ thing, so, right?

speaker: Edward as Magnus
lines: Yeah! I’ve got a way better idea, and hear me out, boys, my best friends. My very good best friends, Merle and Taako. What if you guys turn around and go back into Wonderland and I’ll keep the bell. And you’ll just go back in there, but you’ll get to live! How does that sound?

speaker: Merle
lines: Hmmm.

speaker: Taako
lines: I got a fuckin’ idea for ya.

speaker: Edward as Magnus
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Justin
lines: And as soon as I say that, Taako’s eyes go blank. {5610}

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh shit.

speaker: Justin
lines: He is just catatonic. He falls out of it. His soul is gone. [Griffin Oh- What?] It’s in a magic jar. The spell is called Magic Jar. The only action I can take is to project my soul up to a hundred feet out of the container and return to my living body, or attempting to possess a humanoid’s body. And I’m gonna take Magnus back.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. [slightly panickedly] Alright. Alright. Alright. You cast your soul out of Taako’s body, and as you do, it steps into the ethereal plane. Um, which you’ve been in before, right? It’s where you Blink into. [Justin makes a noise in agreement] And as you start to approach Magnus’ body, you see behind you, you see Magnus and he is being sucked into a rift into the astral plane. And you recognise it, too. You recognise the astral plane from- from Lucas’ lab. You recognise it as Kravitz’s, like, home? It is the plane where dead souls go to, uh, go to the afterlife and, um, you see Magnus getting sucked into this portal. You also see his body in front of you and you see Edward’s faint outline over the body. Which direction do you go?

speaker: Justin
lines: I fly towards Magnus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, which one?

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, spell-Magnus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What?

speaker: Justin
lines: I mean his soul-Magnus!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Soul-Magnus. You fly towards Magnus being sucked into the portal.

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] Trust this—this is so gonna work.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yes. Yes. Soul-Magnus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, um, Magnus, you don’t quite see Taako flying towards you yet. You just see the astral plane rift opening up and sucking you into it. And you see, again, you’ve seen the astral plane before, um, in the cosmoscope you saw it too, in the mirror. And when you saw it then it was just this, like tranquil sea filled with swirling lights and souls retired to rest in collective consciousness.

speaker: Through this rift, you see the same sea, but it is choppy and it’s violent and there are– there’s no lights below the surface. In fact you kinda see what looks like an oil slick on the surface and the sky is stormy and pitch-black and nobody’s there. Kravitz isn’t there. Um, and behind you, you see Taako flying at you. Taako, what are you doing?
Justin
lines: I’m just gonna– I mean, I’m disembodied so all I can do is kinda fly over and try to grab him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Alright, you fly over and you grab Magnus’ hand. And make a strength save.

speaker: Justin
lines: [rolls and laughs] Natural 20.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, here’s what we’ll do. Taako, you grab Magnus’ hand. Just as his feet were being pulled into the astral plane. And you can see into it now, too. You can see into the plane, also. Do you say anything dope when you grab him?

speaker: Justin
lines: No, I mean, I can’t say anything, I’m a ghost.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, fine. [Justin laughs] But you see each other? You guys see each other, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: And we definitely think some super cool action-y quips.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, we think something but it’s very private so it’s not aloud.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You both see into this astral plane and you can tell that something is seriously wrong. And just as you pull Magnus back, Taako, you see a hand splash up from the choppy waters. [Arms Outstretched by Griffin McElroy begins to play] You see Kravitz, and he’s struggling to sort of pull himself up to the surface of the water. The oil -- this black oil on the surface of the water just twists around him and pulls him back under. And you feel that oil calling for both of you as well.

speaker: And you’re both getting pulled into the rift now, and- but with a 20, Taako, you fight against the pull and both of you are flying backwards towards the center of the room, back towards the catwalk. And Merle, you’re standing in front of the two liches, one in the form of Magnus and one not. Lydia just is there in her spectral form. And you’re standing next to a Taako who’s gone completely catatonic. What do you do?
Clint
lines: I use Planar Ally where I can summon an entity from another plane.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [gasps and whispers] Whaaaaat?

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m gonna go into that plane and pull, let’s see, pull Taako who’s got a hold of Magnus, right?

speaker: [simultaneously] Griffin/Justin
lines: Yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I pull him back into this plane. I summon him-- I summon both of them back into this plane.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [stammering] Okay, then, M—Magnus and Taako, you two are flying back towards the center of the room. The pull of this rift is still trying to suck you in. And out of nowhere, just Merle turns around—turns his back to the two liches—and just outstretches his arms and as he does, you see, like, spectral versions of his soul-wood arm sort of reach out and grab you and he’s also pulling you back in too, now. And he rips both of you towards himself.

speaker: Taako, you are back in your body, and you’re back and you are conscious again. And Magnus, you’re conscious, too. You still feel numb but you’re back. But you’re on the ground. And you’re surrounded by the mannequin audience and you see your friends just above you on the catwalk. What do you do?
Travis
lines: Am I in my body or am I just a spirit?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [insistently] What do you do? You’re awake. You’re not in the astral -- you’re not in the ethereal plane anymore.

speaker: Travis
lines: I rush in-, to my friends! I wanna get back in the—I’m back—I rush in! I rush in, Griffin!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright. You jump back up onto the catwalk, and as you do, you hear fake Magnus go

speaker: Edward as Magnus
lines: [gasp] What?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Merle and Taako, you see, standing beside you, wearing a plate of very very very fashionable elven scale-mail, you see one of the mannequins standing right next to you. [Justin laughs]

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’ll be having my body back, you undead fuck.
